sentences.en: A distinction must be made between archaeology proper and science-based archaeology.
sentences.cn: 必须区分考古学本身和以科学为基础的考古学。

sentences.en: Customers are treated without distinction of sex and age.
sentences.cn: 顾客不分男女老幼,一视同仁地对待.
艾略特作为诗人的杰出才能

sentences.en: He displayed a sublime indifference to the distinction between right and wrong.
sentences.cn: 他对是非之间的差别根本就无动于衷。

sentences.en: He has gained a distinction in various fields of scholarly studies.
sentences.cn: 他在多种科学的学术研究中享有盛名.

sentences.en: He is a writer of real distinction.
sentences.cn: 他是一位真正才智超群的作家.

sentences.en: He is fair to us without distinction.
sentences.cn: 他对我们一视同仁,毫无区别.

sentences.en: Her majesty awarded a distinction upon 〔 to 〕 the retiring Prime Minister.
sentences.cn: 女王陛下授勋给行将离任的首相.

sentences.en: I can't see any distinction between these two cases.
sentences.cn: 我看不出这两个案例有什么不同.

sentences.en: Lewis emerges as a composer of distinction and sensitivity.
sentences.cn: 刘易斯作为一位悟性很高的优秀作曲家崭露头角。

sentences.en: Many people make a sharp distinction between humans and other animals.
sentences.cn: 很多人认为人类和其他动物截然不同。

sentences.en: She quotes secondary and primary sources without distinction.
sentences.cn: 她对二手资料和一手资料的引用毫无区别。

sentences.en: the distinction between formal and informal language
sentences.cn: 正式与非正式语言之间的差别

sentences.en: There are obvious distinctions between the two wine-making areas.
sentences.cn: 这两个酿酒区之间有明显的不同。

sentences.en: There is a nice distinction between the two words.
sentences.cn: 这两个词有细微的区别.

sentences.en: This distinction isn't hard and fast.
sentences.cn: 这样的差别并非是一成不变的.

sentences.en: We must draw a clear distinction between ourselves and the enemy.
We must draw a clear distinction between right and wrong.
sentences.cn: 我们必须明确区分是与非.

words.tran_cn: 明显的；独特的；清楚的；有区别的
可区别的；辩认得出的；可辨识的
区分；辨别；使杰出，使表现突出

phrases.tran_cn: 以优异成绩，以杰出的表现

trans.tran_cn: 差别，分别，卓越，特殊奖励，特质，荣誉
trans.tran_en: a clear difference or separation between two similar things
